intro: Naravelia dasyoneura, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dasyoneura, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences and are typically greenish-white in color. Naravelia dasyoneura is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
